description.narrative: The main objective of this capacity development intervention is to enhance knowledge, skills and capacity for the achievement of development goals that are owned by Tanzania as defined in the national, regional and global development agenda.

description.narrative: Existence of a national system for data collection, measurement and analysis to monitor progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals and Development Cooperation Framework (DCF).

comment.narrative: No formal SDG monitoring and reporting system in place DCF document endorsed and available (not action plan)

1. Pilot an SDG implementation discussion forum in a selected region 2. Generation of gender sensitive data for the FYDP II/SDGs and Mkuza III 3. Training statistician and Line ministries staffs on ADAPT as the framework for DPs responses to the data gaps in Tanzania by NBS 4. Dissemination exercise/awareness of the Development Cooperation Framework and dialogue with non state actors 5. Enhancement and upgrade of the Aid Management Platform 6. Mainstreaming of Mkuza III into Line Ministries Plans 7. Facilitation of data dissemination and access policy for Zanzibar

1. An SDG implementation discussion forum took place in Singida Region with representatives from 7 LGAs, Singida Regional Office and President’s Office Regional Administration and Local Government (PO-RALG). The Region of Singida was selected as a pilot to identify the challenges in implementing the SDGs and propose key recommendation. Poor infrastructure to support the education system, inadequate participation of government leaders at the lowest level in the planning and budgeting processes are some of the challenges recorded. Provision of training on preparing Business Plan, Feasibility Study, Cash flow, SWOT Analysis will help LGAs in securing funds from the Central Government and other Development Partners to design Strategic Projects.
2.The National Bureau of Statistics conducted a workshop to review gender related indicators and generated data, resulting in a Dashboard which will be publicly available on the Tanzania Socio-economic Database (TSED) in 2019. A need for further actions to develop sector strategies for generation of indicators was identified. In Zanzibar, the RGoZ/MOFP has successfully completed a gender indicator mapping of the MKUZA III and SDGs. Further to this, a mechanism to report against these indicators at national and international level is being elaborated.
3. A training on the ADAPT took place with attendance of statisticians/economists from MDAs, statisticians and GIS staff from NBS and dLab. Participants were capacitated on the ADAPT in terms of log frames, data demand and supply, data sources and reporting.
4. The Ministry of Finance and Planning is finalizing a Swahili translation of the DCF. Dissemination is expected to take place in 2019. A dialogue meeting took place between the Ministry of Finance and Planning and selected CSOs on CSO partnerships and development cooperation, outlining the need for further involvement of CSOs in the DC processes. Guidelines have been developed for the role of non-state actors in the implementation of the DCF and related action plan.
5. Training conducted on the AMP for External Finance Department staff and for AMP Focal Persons from Development Partners, responsible for the provision of data. Furthermore, the MoFP has produced reports mapping the existing ODA flows and exploring new development financing opportunities and current gaps.
6. Results expected in 2019
7. Results expected in 2019

Output 1: - The Zanzibar Development Vision 2020 reviewed, and proposals made for successor strategy - Gender-based reports incorporated gender into the PRAP Output 2: - Database developed for Zanzibar for collection, management and analysis of data from development plans, sectoral level activities and SDGs. - Data preparation for SDG data visualization and dissemination portal for the Voluntary National Review (VNR 2019) Output 3 - New Zanzibar Vision 2050 drafted - Support 5 LGAs in preparing fundable projects to secure funds from MoFP through Strategic Project Initiative. Output 4 - Training on MPI delivered Output 5: - ODA manual reviewed, emphasizing on clearer procedures for initiation of projects and programmes at sector level and signing of bilateral agreements - Working session on the transformation of AMP knowledge and experience

Output 1: - The Zanzibar Development Vision review was supported and is still ongoing into 2020. - A desk review and workshop was held suporting the incorporation of gender into the PRAP. The process of incorporating suggested and relevant gender issues in PRAP will continue in 2020. Output 2: - The SDG database was developed. Roll-out will take place in 2020. -Data was collected and visualized for the 2019 VNR Output 3: - Initial support was provided to the 2050 review process however this will continue into 2050 - Capacity development of five LGAs from Tanga, Morogoro and Coastal region was supported. The participants from LGAs included planning officers and other officers responsible for preparing strategic projects. Output 4: - Key staff were trained on the MPI. Output 5: - The ODA manual was reviewed - A working session was conducted, which collected lessons learned from the AMP system and translated it to recommendations for the new TERMD system which is under development.

- Support provided for development of SDG Roadmap including publication and dissemination - Development of National Strategy for Development of statistics (NSDS) is finalized - Development of National statistics Policy is finalized - At least one National conference on production and use of data for sustainable development is conducted - At least 4 awareness dialogue sessions on SDG and MKUZA III are organized in four different districts - Support provided to develop and disseminate various SDG and MKUZA III IEC materials aiming at raising awareness on the subject matter

The project successfully facilitated the development of SDG Roadmap which has been publicized too, for this reporting period a National Strategy for Development of statistics (NSDS) and National statistics Policy were finalized including a National conference on production and use of data for sustainable development was conducted involving different stakeholders.

- Coordinated and gender sensitive M&E framework for SDGs, FYDP III, MKUZA III established - FYDP III and its associated frameworks finalised and launched - SDGs, FYDPs, EAC Vision 2050, and Africa Agenda 2063 data Visualization and dissemination portal for Tanzania established - 15 LGAs trained about Local Economic Development (LED) Framework and development of LED strategies Regions and LGAs - THDR 2021 for Mainland prepared with the theme: Financing for Development - Two Strategic Dialogue meetings between DPs and Government undertaken to foster development cooperation in Tanzania - Three sector level dialogues focusing on health, education and water undertaken
